title: Problems with updates
content:
Some time back, I let Firefox install an update. Uninstalled it a short time later cause I was getting flooded with ads. Happened again. Tried to ignore it and not install it but it was like my computer was taken over by Microsoft, couldn't do anything. One window had something about Trojan something couldn't read it windows were overlapping. One said I needed to allow the Firefox update or they would freeze up my computer. I couldn't do anything so used the task manager to kill it all. Then allowed Firefox to update. Now have all the ads again. Also, in Firefox settings, something new. Top of page, message says: "Your browser is being managed by your organization." Click on it and see this:

Active Policy Name Policy Value Certificates ImportEnterpriseRoots true

My personal computer, no idea where this is coming from or what it means. Anyone tell me what's going on. Had some problems with PC Matic a while ago (not virus or anything), just decided I needed a change. When I tried to uninstall it, it was a real mess. Totally locked me out of one of my other computers.

Thought this one was OK. The other one will now boot but will not make it through a restart unless I skip the part of the restart that does malware checks

content:

Also remove all data (settings / private / cookies / all data) doesn't solve the problem.

With other browsers (Chrome, Safari) there isn't any problem. In older versions of Firefox, there wasn't any problem.

Best Regards Fred Strang

title: gmail not working in Firefox
content:
Yesterday when I tried to open my gmail in Firefox I got this page coming up Clear cache & cookies

When you use a browser, like Chrome, it saves some information from websites in its cache and cookies. Clearing them fixes certain problems, like loading or formatting issues on sites. Computer AndroidiPhone & iPad In Chrome 

   On your computer, open Chrome.    At the top right, click More More and then Delete browsing data.    Choose a time range, like Last hour or All time.    Select the types of information you want to remove.    Click Delete data.        If you delete cookies while signed in to Chrome, you won't be signed out of your Google Account.

I'm concerned about deleting data, it's always worked until yesterday.

Should I follow these instructions?

title: Segnalazione bug sugli homebanking
content:
Buongiorno,

con la presente vorrei segnalare che, in seguito all'ultimo aggiornamento di Firefox 134.0b10 (aarch64), è comparso un bug sull'homebanking: al posto della cifra "0" zero viene visualizzato il carattere "," virgola. Questo bug non era presente nelle versioni precedenti e non è presente in altri browser (ho fatto delle prove con Safari e Chrome). È piuttosto spiacevole, come bug, perché rende illeggibili le movimentazioni sul conto corrente. Spero sia risolvibile in breve.

Grazie per la disponibilità. Cordiali saluti,

Beatrice
creator: beatricespada95

title: FF settings for zoom not there
content:
I have tried reinstalling Ffox ad nauseum but the zoom settings will not 'stick' and don't survive a quit and restart. In an effort to sort this I have installed Firefox 128.5.2esr but now the zoom setting does not work at all.

Tried everyting, including deleting all ref to Ffox and reinstalling but nothing works.

Note that I install in the admin account and run as user. This worked fine with MacOS Ventrura but fails with Sequoia. If I install from the user account with admin privileges zoom does work but fails on a machine restart.

Safari, Vivaldi etc all work as expected. It's only Ffox that has the problem. Shame as I've used it for years. If I can't solve this I shall have to go over to Vivaldi and give Chromium another shot in the arm.

Any help appreciated.

MAcOS Sequoia 15.2 Mac Mini M2Pro
creator: tacitus99

title: Om Setu Yogashala
content: Our yoga journey began in Rishikesh, the yoga capital, with the goal of spreading yoga knowledge throughout the world. We take great pride in preserving the unadulterated purity of traditional Indian yoga. In Rishikesh, there is a traditional yoga school called Om Setu Yogashala. who offer a variety of traditional yoga programs, including Ayurvedic retreats, yoga teacher training, and yoga retreats. The Indian government, Yoga Alliance USA, and Yoga Alliance International have all registered Om Setu Yogashala.

title: Icon poluting the print out of web pages
content:
Hello everybody, I'm facing an issue with an icon appearing on some sites and propagating down to the print out of the pages. Let me give an example: I'm interested in an article published on: https://www.electronicdesign.com/technologies/analog/article/55246421/modeling-on-mondays-nonlinear-spice-models-of-vacuum-tube-triodes-part-3?o_eid=9960G5790701E5D&oly_enc_id=9960G5790701E5D&rdx.ident[pull]=omeda|9960G5790701E5D&utm_campaign=CPS241216087&utm_medium=email&utm_source=ED+Power+%26+Analog When I open this page, an icon appears in the low left corner. And when I try to print the page, the icon appears on each page. If I use the simplified print mode, a kind of background of the icon (white box) is still visible on each page and can hide the text behind. On top of that the images no longer appear in the print out...

Any help to sanitize that is welcome.

title: Navigating in the digital world when it didn't exist when you were young?
content: I am not going to embellish on the confusion that I am experiencing right now. Because I really don't know how to explain it completely. But I use Firefox and Google. And I have a Gmail and a proton mail accounts and have changed my passwords so many times I couldn't possibly remember. But I am only trying to simplify the complications I have caused over the years in my own digital world.
creator: doyttrail

title: I never kept or knew that I had a password for Mozilla and I have changed my passwords for so many different accounts over the years that it's very difficult to get my passwords and accounts back on track. I use Google and Mozilla
content: It's sort of difficult for me to explain. Other than I have used both Mozilla and Google. I have a Gmail account and a Proton mail account and I changed my email for Gmail by eliminating the last four digits of my social security number. Which used to be my Gmail address and I believe that I was using my last four digits for my proton mail account also? But to be honest I am not really sure of that? So to attempt to simplify my situation. [edited] @gmail.com is my email address for Gmail and I really don't know if I changed this for proton mail account also. I am definitely getting old. Because I will be 68 on the 23 of this month. And I remember the days when none of this even existed. So I am sure that there must be someone who can help me straighten this mess that I created out and please help me simplify my life again. Thanks to whoever reads this and replies. They have to understand that cell phones didn't exist for me and many others when I was young. Computers didn't exist as we know them then either. But obviously I have learned alot in my 68 years of existence.
creator: doyttrail

title: zoom error in addons/ extensions and toolbar
content: when we set the default zoom some percentage e.g. 80% in settings> the zoom level of the toolbar/ addons/ extensions is not set to 80% also there is no option to set the zoom for particular sections such as zoom for the system toolbar, pages, side menu, address bar. The main issue is when the default is decreased> the zoom in the addons/ extensions remains still at 100% which pop-ups on the screen and the addons/ extensions settings cannot be accessed due to zoom in on the panel (it happens when scaling of the windows in set to high percentage such as 130%) so the Firefox zooms in at 130% by default (considering it as 100% in firefox)> and decreasing zoom to 80% (to get 100% zoom from 130% in firefox) so it doesn't work> u understand> what is the solution tell quickly. I have tried to set the compatibility Troubleshoot and override the system Scaling in Program settings. It also doesn't work. Tell me the solution soon.

title: Where did my extentions go?
content:
I can see and manipulate my extensions in the little puzzle piece in my toolbar but when I go into settings all my extensions are gone, replaced by an extension I did not authorize. I was having difficulty with a pop-up on a news site that wanted me to turn off my add blocker or buy a subscription. When I go into the add browser and turn it off the website does not recognize that I have do this and keeps me from getting behind their pay wall. So I thought I would go into the settings and temporarily turn off the extension from there and that is when I discovered the lack of extensions in my settings.

The add on is AdBlocker Ultimate and the website is RawStory.com

title: Firefox is changing white backgrounds to blue
content:
Hello all,

Ever since an update to Firefox from a few weeks ago, I have been having issues with white backgrounds displaying incorrectly in Firefox. I have attached two identical images from the NYT homepage: the first is a screenshot from Chrome and the second is the same exact image but taken from Firefox.

I have also attached another screenshot taken in Firefox from REI.com. You'll see that it's not necessarily just a white background that is causing the weird blue color. It also happens in products images being displayed incorrectly.

I figured this might be a Firefox website appearance setting, but I have played around with it and selected many different permutations and I haven't been able to solve this issue. I have also tried refreshing Firefox, using Firefox in Safemode, disabling all of my plugins/themes, etc. and nothing was fixed.

I am pretty sure this isn't a system wide issue or a monitor issue because these websites are being displayed 100% correct in Chrome and Edge. This is only an issue in Firefox.

Can someone advise?


Thanks,

DC
creator: climbwithahelmet
